meanings.definition: Tyrannosauruses: plural noun, a group of large carnivorous dinosaurs of the genus Tyrannosaurus.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, the exhibit showcased the impressive skeletons of tyrannosauruses.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fossils of tyrannosauruses to learn more about these ancient predators.
meanings.sent3: During the dinosaur party, the tyrannosauruses were the life of the party with their big teeth and claws.
meanings.sent4: The tyrannosauruses of the past ruled the prehistoric world with their sheer size and power.
meanings.sent5: The children's book vividly illustrated the fierce battles between different tyrannosauruses.

meanings.definition: Tyrannosauruses: verb, the act of behaving in a tyrannical or oppressive manner, similar to that of a tyrannosaurus.
meanings.sent1: The boss would often tyrannosauruses his employees, making them work long hours without breaks.
meanings.sent2: When the bully tried to tyrannosauruses the smaller kids, the teacher intervened to stop the behavior.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to tyrannosauruses the other pets in the house, always getting the best spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: The dictator would tyrannosauruses his people, controlling every aspect of their lives.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds seemed to tyrannosauruses the peaceful town, casting a dark shadow over everything.
